node.title: Florida School District to Pay Over $26M to Families, Survivors in 2018 Parkland Massacre
node.description: A $25 million settlement was awarded to 51 people, including the families of the deceased. Andy Borges was awarded $1.25 million for his severe injuries.

node.title: Meat Industry Association appeals for more halal butchers to be allowed into NZ
node.description: The meat processing industry is getting frustrated with the lack of halal butchers being allowed into the country.

node.title: Torrential rain eases in Canterbury, caution still advised
node.description: Rain has eased in Christchurch and Canterbury, and a council official believes the worst has passed.

node.title: Want to pay ground rates to ship holiday gifts? USPS and FedEx deadlines explained
node.description: Today is the last day to ship gifts via USPS or FedEx standard ground service to get them to their destination by December 25

node.title: Theranos and the Logic of Start-up Bets
node.description: In the start-up world, there can be big payoff for investing and little incentive for asking questions.

node.title: Vaccines Alone Won't Stop Omicron COVID Variant, Says WHO Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus
node.description: The health agency leader said vaccines will need to be used alongside masking and other measures, and voiced concerns about booster hoarding.

node.title: Kentucky Tornado Survivor Reunited With Dog She Feared Dead
node.description: Deanna Badillo's home in Mayfield was destroyed in the tornado outbreak that killed at least 88 people.

node.title: Animal Enforcement Officer Jennifer Lynn George Accused of Abandoning Dog, Leaving It to Die
node.description: The woman allegedly left her German shepherd behind after moving to a new residence in December 2020.

node.title: Jim Bob Duggar Loses Arkansas Primary Bid Days After Son Josh Convicted in Porn Case
node.description: "I want to thank those of you who voted for me... and supported me in my race for Arkansas State Senate District 7," Duggar said in a statement.

node.title: Fury As Manager Tells Pregnant Employee to Wait for Cover If She Goes Into Labor at Work
node.description: The woman told a Reddit forum she had been ordered to either wait for cover or contact two superiors to get permission to close the store herself—once customers had left.

node.title: New independent redress system for abuse survivors to be set up
node.description: Public Service Minister Chris Hipkins acknowledges there have been failings in providing redress, and says it's "a national disgrace" that it has taken this long to get to this point.

node.title: Tips for taking the stress out of last-minute flight changes
node.description: Hundreds of flights get canceled last-minute as a result of winter storms and COVID-19. Be prepared.

node.title: Hobby Lobby to pay workers a minimum of $18.50 an hour
node.description: Craft chain's 43,000 employees are getting a big raise next month. Elsewhere, Taco Bell to pay $15 base by mid-2024.

node.title: Meet the couple behind NASCAR driver Kyle Larson's comeback
node.description: Michelle and Anthony Martin co-founded Philadelphia's Urban Youth Racing School, an organization that connects young people of color with the racing industry.

node.title: The Corset Keeps Coming Back
node.description: As we trade sweatpants for formality and fun, corsets are one of the things to reign supreme.

node.title: Raven O, a Nightlife Fixture for Four Decades, Takes a Final Bow
node.description: Since the ’80s, Raven O has choreographed, directed, hosted, danced and sung on many New York stages. After three final shows, he’ll return to Hawaii.

node.title: Review: ‘Messiah’ Brings the New York Philharmonic to Church
node.description: Jeannette Sorrell led superb voices and a stylish orchestra in Handel’s classic of the holiday season at Riverside Church.
